verses.text: Run ye to and fro through the streets of Jerusalem , and see now, and know , and seek in the broad places thereof, if ye can find a man , if there be \add any\add* that executeth judgment , that seeketh the truth ; and I will pardon it.
And though they say , The \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* liveth ; surely they swear falsely.

O \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd*, \add are\add* not thine eyes upon the truth ? thou hast stricken them, but they have not grieved ; thou hast consumed them, \add but\add* they have refused to receive correction : they have made their faces harder than a rock ; they have refused to return.
Therefore I said , Surely these \add are\add* poor ; they are foolish : for they know not the way of the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd*, \add nor\add* the judgment of their God.

I will get me unto the great men , and will speak unto them; for they have known the way of the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd*, \add and\add* the judgment of their God : but these have altogether broken the yoke , \add and\add* burst the bonds.

Wherefore a lion out of the forest shall slay them, \add and\add* a wolf of the evenings shall spoil them, a leopard shall watch over their cities : every one that goeth out thence shall be torn in pieces : because their transgressions are many , \add and\add* their backslidings are increased.\f + \fr 5.6 \ft evenings: or, deserts\f*\f + \fr 5.6 \ft are increased: Heb. are strong\f* \p

¶ How shall I pardon thee for this ? thy children have forsaken me, and sworn by \add them that are\add* no gods : when I had fed them to the full , they then committed adultery , and assembled themselves by troops in the harlots’ houses.
They were \add as\add* fed horses in the morning : every one neighed after his neighbour’s wife.
Shall I not visit for these \add things\add*? saith the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd*: and shall not my soul be avenged on such a nation as this? \p
¶ Go ye up upon her walls , and destroy ; but make not a full end : take away her battlements ; for they \add are\add* not the \nd \+w LORD’s|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd*.
For the house of Israel and the house of Judah have dealt very treacherously against me, saith the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd*.
They have belied the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd*, and said , \add It is\add* not he; neither shall evil come upon us; neither shall we see sword nor famine :
And the prophets shall become wind , and the word \add is\add* not in them: thus shall it be done unto them.

Wherefore thus saith the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* God of hosts , Because ye speak this word , behold, I will make my words in thy mouth fire , and this people wood , and it shall devour them.

Lo, I will bring a nation upon you from far , O house of Israel , saith the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd*: it \add is\add* a mighty nation , it \add is\add* an ancient nation , a nation whose language thou knowest not, neither understandest what they say.
Their quiver \add is\add* as an open sepulchre , they \add are\add* all mighty men.

And they shall eat up thine harvest , and thy bread , \add which\add* thy sons and thy daughters should eat : they shall eat up thy flocks and thine herds : they shall eat up thy vines and thy fig trees : they shall impoverish thy fenced cities , wherein thou trustedst , with the sword.
Nevertheless in those days , saith the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd*, I will not make a full end with you. \p

¶ And it shall come to pass, when ye shall say , Wherefore doeth the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* our God all these \add things\add* unto us? then shalt thou answer them, Like as ye have forsaken me, and served strange gods in your land , so shall ye serve strangers in a land \add that is\add* not yours. \p
Declare this in the house of Jacob , and publish it in Judah , saying ,
Hear now this, O foolish people , and without understanding ; which have eyes , and see not; which have ears , and hear not:\f + \fr 5.21 \ft understanding: Heb. heart\f*

Fear ye not me? saith the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd*: will ye not tremble at my presence , which have placed the sand \add for\add* the bound of the sea by a perpetual decree , that it cannot pass it: and though the waves thereof toss themselves, yet can they not prevail ; though they roar , yet can they not pass over it?
But this people hath a revolting and a rebellious heart ; they are revolted and gone.

Neither say they in their heart , Let us now fear the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* our God , that giveth rain , both the former and the latter , in his season : he reserveth unto us the appointed weeks of the harvest. \p
¶ Your iniquities have turned away these \add things\add*, and your sins have withholden good \add things\add* from you.
For among my people are found wicked \add men:\add* they lay wait , as he that setteth snares ; they set a trap , they catch men.\f + \fr 5.26 \ft they lay…: or, they pry as fowlers lie in wait\f*
As a cage is full of birds , so \add are\add* their houses full of deceit : therefore they are become great , and waxen rich.\f + \fr 5.27 \ft cage: or, coop\f*

They are waxen fat , they shine : yea, they overpass the deeds of the wicked : they judge not the cause , the cause of the fatherless , yet they prosper ; and the right of the needy do they not judge.
Shall I not visit for these \add things\add*? saith the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd*: shall not my soul be avenged on such a nation as this? \p
¶ A wonderful and horrible thing is committed in the land ;\f + \fr 5.30 \ft A wonderful…: or, Astonishment and filthiness\f*

The prophets prophesy falsely , and the priests bear rule by their means ; and my people love \add to have it\add* so: and what will ye do in the end thereof?\f + \fr 5.31 \ft bear…: or, take into their hands\f*
